subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Jet Stream and Blocking Patterns
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Jet Stream and Blocking Patterns.

hook.text: The jet stream is a river of fast wind 10 km above Earth. It steers weather across continents.

buildup.text: It flows west to east, driven by the temperature difference between the equator and the poles.

discovery.text: As the Arctic warms faster than the tropics, that temperature gap shrinks and the jet stream weakens.

twist.text: A weaker jet stream wobbles more, creating stuck weather patterns â€” prolonged heat or cold.

climax.text: These blocking patterns trapped the 2021 heat dome over the Pacific Northwest for days.

punchline.text: The wind that moves our weather is slowing down. Weather is getting stuck.

quiz.question: Why is the jet stream weakening?
options: The Arctic is warming faster, reducing the temperature gap
